snippet: To aid defense contractors, researchers try to map how butterflies carry out an astonishing variety of flight maneuvers.
abstract: To aid defense contractors, researchers try to map how butterflies carry out an astonishing variety of flight maneuvers.
lead_paragraph: In research financed by defense agencies, engineers are using high-speed video cameras to document how butterflies flutter gracefully among flowers. The goal is to develop bug-size flying robots, known as micro-aerial vehicles, or MAV's, that carry out reconnaissance and search-and-rescue missions. [John Hopkins University]

headline.main: On Our Radar: Military Drones That Mimic Butterflies
